name: Avetinja (Demo)
description:
Avetinja (pronounced ə-ve-tɪ-njɑ:) is a puzzle roguelike RPG inspired by Serbian and Slavic myth. Players take on the role of one of three classes as they fight their way through various monsters, hoping to reach the castle that's "neither in the sky nor on the earth" and defeat the dreaded Avetinja.

Players will fight monsters in one-on-one battles, matching tiles with gameplay inspired by match-2 games like Clickomania and classic RPGs and roguelites. Many item and ability combinations will not just improve your chances of survival, but may even break the game if you're clever and lucky enough!

This version of the game is a "proof of concept demo," and is meant to offer a taste of what a single area of the full game would play like.

Features:

  • Gorgeous hand-drawn artwork
  • Simple tile-matching gameplay that's easy to pick up, but hard to master
  • A tooltip system that will explain various items and special mechanics you mouse over
  • 3 character classes, each with unique abilities that affect their gameplay style
  • Over 50 items you can equip, activate or consume
  • 27 perks (called "boons" and "burdens") that will help or hinder you in your adventure
  • 6 enemy types
  • 3 special encounters
  • A leveling system that lets you improve your character's stats
  • An inheritance mechanic that lets your pass on a single item to your next character if you die

Credits:

  • Game Design by RealSovietBear
  • Programming by Nidoking
  • Art by Anthony Lloyd Jones
